task.title: Removing Valves for Grinding
task.shortdesc: Procedure for safely removing engine valves to prepare for valve grinding and maintenance.

prereq.p:
Before beginning, ensure you have:
Valve lifting tool
Appropriate hand tools
Clean work area
Safety equipment (gloves, eye protection)

context.p: Valve removal is a critical step in engine maintenance, allowing for valve grinding and inspection of valve components.

step.info: Completely empty the radiator to prevent coolant spillage during engine disassembly.
Carefully detach the cylinder head to access the valve mechanism.

step.cmd: Remove the two valve covers on the right side of the engine
step.info: This provides direct access to the valve springs and valve mechanism.

step.cmd: Raise the valve spring using a lifting tool
step.info: Use the valve lifting tool to compress the valve spring.

step.cmd: Remove the pin under the valve seat
step.info: With the spring compressed, carefully pull out the small pin securing the valve.
Once the pin is removed, carefully lift the valve out by its head.

result.p: The valve has been successfully removed and is ready for grinding or further inspection.

postreq.p:
After valve removal:
Clean the valve thoroughly
Inspect for any damage or wear
Prepare for grinding or replacement
Keep all removed components organized
